content.description: Ascend small crimps to a slopey top-out. Crux is the top.
content.protection: 1-2 Pads and a good spotter to avoid hitting the wall of rock and poison oak in the landing zone; Yikes!
content.location: At the entrance to Indian Joe Caves area; accessed directly from the hiking trail, walk past the slab leading to the caves, and this problem looms ahead.

content.description: Fun warmup slab with tiny edges.
This is an extension of The Pit. Start in the cave below the beginning of the climb, use the horizontal crack to climb out and join the original climb. Pad well!
Start in the large pocket and work your way up. Arete is off, v2 with arete on.
content.protection: At least one pad, a spotter would be nice!
content.location: To the left of the pit climb. Mini Fin climb on the opposite side of the boulder.

content.description:
This is a slab climb below the top of the Murrieta crack.

Start off a small boulder at about the middle of the wall to make your way up and right over a small bulge to top out.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter might be useful, maybe better not to fall. Watch for poison oak.
content.location: If you aproach the main entrance with Indian Joe and the Western Gold boulder, you'll walk left past the obvious double crack. Around the corner on the same rock you'll see the Murrieta crack and the starting hold for Ranchero.

content.description: Start on the obvious two good opposing edges and do a long dynamic move to a small edge. From here move up the obvious but somewhat cryptic holds to the shelf and mantle to the top. Don't fall after the first couple of moves theres a man sized hole right in the landing zone under the mantle on the shelf.
content.protection: At least 3 or 4 pads minimum! The landing sucks. Spotters might help.
content.location: In a pit below the 5.11a arete and the 5.12c. hard to miss if you love bouldering and are headed down hill towards fools gold and the Indian joe boulder which is around the corner. Really bad landing.

content.description:
Fantastic sideways jams going up the crack with good slaby feet to a platform just below the top out with a view of the valley and the lovely oaks. Great for some laps at sunset.

Down climb the detached flake on your left and repeat.
content.protection: Can absolutely be trad climbed using the same trad gear a trad climber would use while trad climbing.
content.location: As you approach joes from the valley, you'll see the top of this route to your left on the largest boulder. To get the start, find your way to the opposite side of the rock.

content.description: Start one hand on the ledge between rocks, one on arete. GO UP! or ya know, do you.
content.protection: Do you really need that pad? Super flat, with no obstacles. Best landing at the caves!
content.location: Big arete behind western gold boulder, with Robbin Hood of the West on the back side.

content.description: Sit start and climb the obvious line. Tricky!
content.location: In between two boulders left of Western Gold

content.description: Low start to Western Gold on tiny edges
content.location: Back of the caves near the he trail

content.description: Start the same as the direct line and Traverse to the left to top out.
content.protection: Lots of pads, really bad landing.

climbs.name: Bushwacker Direct Low
climbs.fa: Mike Donovan, Zach Miller, Mark Avery and others

content.description: start matched on sloper and move right to jug and head up the arete.  Left kneepad helps.
content.protection: about 4 bouldering pads preferred.  3 minimum and any less gets kind of sketchy.
content.location: cave at the base of the 12c route. approach cave from right side of boulder field as you come up from the approach

content.description: Start low and compress your way up to the very top. Don't bail out left. variation finishes to the right of the fin, spooky!
content.protection: Don't fall there's currently a massive poison oak bush behind this boulder.
content.location:
Below the Northwest Roof Rock Problem, can be accessed by going left when entering the main caves area near Indian Joe and Fools Gold.

You can either go all the way down the creek to a flat grassy area, or take a right before the creek drops and scramble your way over the rocks and down to the boulder.
